Extreme negativity, racism and jealousy. Making fun of patients charts/diagnosis! Happy when the client is not able to be helped or lacks paperwork.  A potential employee quit due to how they were treated at the drug screening! That's a day in the lab. Management turns a blind eye. 
Jealous woman got upset when a patient complemented me, stormed out. The woman felt so bad for me that she gave me her number.

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Pullman, WA
pros: Great community, and employees value one another.
Autonomy, good pay, excellent care. Superior facilities

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Pullman, WA
pros: PRH has a great culture. If you live in Pullman, getting to work is fast and easy. The lab has some new instruments which is nice.
cons: As with the Lab profession, the pay disparity within the field vs other departments at the hospital is evident. The lab has one main chemistry analyzer. This is fine when it is operational, but when maintenance is needed, there isn't much you can do- which makes for an overly stressful environment when you have Stat orders from people dying in the ED.

pros: There’s so much opportunity for learning and growth. The people and patients we get to work with are exceptional, to say the least. The technology we get to use is up to date and beyond that. The support for the future of our hospital isn’t just talk. We’re a small town hospital with big big dreams.
cons: Close working quarters. The hospital has been steadily growing for the good, but really needs to make some more room for just about every single department to be more comfortable.

pros: Great at training, I feel more confident each day. Never afraid to ask my supervisors questions
cons: Long shifts but that's normal in a hospital

Forward thinking health provider with a mission of caring, healing and empowering the community. Education for increased health literacy for better health outcomes.
cons: Have not fully utilized my educational background & experience.
None it was a good atmosphere

review_title: Started out great, but I'm so thankful I left.
pros: Benefits are decent, and they are often willing to hire new grads / newly certified candidates. Most of the staff I worked with love teaching others, and I was able to learn a lot.
cons: The cliques are worse than high school. If you aren't part of the "in" crowd, be prepared to have rumors spread about you that have zero basis in reality. Administration has not been forward-thinking for a long time and has done very little to prepare this hospital for the modern era of acute care. Pay increases for non-union staff are pitiful; one year, I received a 9 cent raise. The new hires were earning more than I was after 2+ years.

review_title: Stay away if you want to have growth opportunities.
pros: Fair pay for the region. A small hospital so you are not completely overwhelmed by patient flow, however the staff act like they are overworked.
cons: Senior management is not truthful. Senior management has been together for 25 years and they protect each other. At the same time they do not communicate so they are not on the same page. Senior management has a cozy relationship with the board of directors. The board is supposed to provide oversight to protect the interests of the community but that is not the case. There are cliques in the organization that impact the overall quality of patient care.

review_title: Benefits are decent, pay is fair, community makes it worth it.
pros: Benefits, Adequate Time Off, Friendly Co-Workers, Decent Pay
cons: Bad Attitudes in Management (TEMPERS), No Real Reviews

review_title: Great company that encourages individual growth
pros: I learned a lot between my time working with the hospital and classes at WSU.  It is a great accessory to learning and fantastic resume building opportunity.
Great culture, employee and patient focus, leadership is transparent and trustworthy
cons: None that I can think of
